heineken.title: When it all started
heineken.copy: Back in 1873 a young entrepreneur named Gerard Heineken discovered a passion for brewing. So he purchased a piece of land in what is now the centre of Amsterdam, built a brewery and set about perfecting the recipe that would soon become Holland’s first ‘premium’ lager beer.

heineken.title: Nation symbol of quality
heineken.copy: Word quickly spread and the name Heineken, stamped onto every single bottle, became a national symbol of quality.

heineken.title: 140 years of expansion
heineken.copy: Over the next 140 years his brewery expanded and Gerard’s children and grandchildren explored new worlds, but the name on the bottle always remained the same.

heineken.title: The family name
heineken.copy: Today, four generations later, they’re still passionate about brewing a truly premium beer. After all, when your family name is at stake, you care a little more.

heineken.title: Purity of your beer
heineken.copy: t’s been 140 years since Heineken has been able to call itself a microbrewer. And while we’re proud that 25 million Heineken’s are served each day across 192 countries, we’ve never forgotten that the quality is measured not in the size of your brand but in the purity of your beer.

nike.title: Zero carbon and zero waste
nike.copy: Move to Zero is Nike’s journey toward zero carbon and zero waste to help protect the future of sport. We exist to serve athletes everywhere and that’s why we’re on a mission to help ensure a healthy planet. For us, there is no finish line.

nike.title: The next generation
nike.copy: In the face of today’s challenges—from climate change to inequality to how we unleash the potential of the next generation I believe we need our boldest dreams yet.

nike.title: Renewable energy
nike.copy: When you ship so many orders every year globally, finding ways to do this more sustainably has a real impact. For example, The Court, our newest distribution center, is powered completely by renewable energy and recycles 95% of its waste.

nike.title: Climate action
nike.copy: We know that with an athlete’s mindset—determination, persistence, and relentlessness—we can use the power of sport to move the world toward climate action.

nike.title: Recycle your sneakers
nike.copy: Waste should not be wasted. Recycle your sneakers and transform them into Nike Grind material, used in performance products and sport surfaces.

vattenfall.title: Vattenfall Europe
vattenfall.copy: Vattenfall’s main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 20,000 employees.

vattenfall.title: Vattenfall
vattenfall.copy: The parent company, Vattenfall AB, is 100% owned by the Swedish state, and its headquarters are in Solna, Sweden.

vattenfall.title: The future is fossil free
vattenfall.copy: We want to make fossil free living possible within one generation and we are driving the transition to a sustainable energy system.

vattenfall.title: This is Vattenfall
vattenfall.copy: We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years.

vattenfall.title: Strategy and goals
vattenfall.copy: Vattenfall has developed a strategy with the purpose to Power Climate Smarter Living and enable fossil free living within one generation. This commitment to our customers, stakeholders and employees provides clear direction, engagement and focus as well as significant business opportunities.
